verses.plain: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

tokens.t: But now
younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

verses.plain: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

tokens.t: Yea, whereto
the strength of their hands
me, in whom old age was perished?

verses.plain: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

tokens.t: For want and famine
solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

verses.plain: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

tokens.t: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots
their meat.

verses.plain: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

tokens.t: They were driven forth from among
, (they cried after them as
a thief;)

verses.plain: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

tokens.t: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys,
caves of the earth, and
the rocks.

verses.plain: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

tokens.t: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

verses.plain: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

tokens.t: children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

verses.plain: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

tokens.t: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

verses.plain: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

tokens.t: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

verses.plain: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

tokens.t: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

verses.plain: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

tokens.t: Upon
right
rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

verses.plain: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

tokens.t: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

verses.plain: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

tokens.t: They came
as a wide breaking in
in the desolation they rolled themselves

verses.plain: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

tokens.t: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

verses.plain: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

tokens.t: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

verses.plain: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

tokens.t: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

verses.plain: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

tokens.t: By the great force
is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

verses.plain: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

tokens.t: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

verses.plain: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

tokens.t: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me

verses.plain: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

tokens.t: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

verses.plain: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

tokens.t: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride
, and dissolvest my substance.

verses.plain: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

tokens.t: For I know
thou wilt bring me
death, and
the house appointed for all living.

verses.plain: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

tokens.t: Howbeit he will not stretch out
hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

verses.plain: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?

tokens.t: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was
my soul grieved for the poor?

verses.plain: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

tokens.t: When I looked for good, then evil came
and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

verses.plain: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

tokens.t: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

verses.plain: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

tokens.t: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up,
I cried in the congregation.

verses.plain: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

tokens.t: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

verses.plain: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

tokens.t: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

verses.plain: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

tokens.t: My harp also is
to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

footnotes.text: younger…: Heb. of fewer days than I
solitary: or, dark as the night
base…: Heb. men of no name
and…: Heb. and withhold not spittle from
my soul: Heb. my principal one
become…: Heb. turned to be cruel
thy…: Heb. the strength of thy hand
in trouble: Heb. hard of day?
